techniques.name: High Line Roundhouse Kicks
techniques.description: Continues the exploration of the roundhouse kick numbering system by focusing on high line (head) targets. This section covers the mechanics of right and left head kicks, including clearing the shoulder for effective execution, and introduces the question mark kick as a deceptive high line technique.

strategies.establishing: Mastering head kick mechanics for both right and left kicks, emphasizing the importance of clearing the shoulder.
strategies.faking: Using lower level kicks or teeps as feints to set up the question mark kick, misleading the opponent about the intended target.
strategies.combining: Incorporating head kicks into combinations, using the question mark kick to capitalize on established threats to lower targets.

techniques.description: Executed with an emphasis on clearing the opponent's shoulder, delivering a powerful strike to the head.
Similar to the right head kick but without the shoulder obstruction, allowing for a more direct path to the target.
A deceptive kick that starts with the motion of a lower kick or a teep, then snaps into a head kick, aiming to catch the opponent off-guard.

strategies.establishing: Preparing for high line attacks by practicing head movement and kick blocks.
strategies.faking: Reading the opponent's setup movements to anticipate and evade high line kicks.
strategies.combining: Using the opponent's commitment to a high line attack as an opportunity for counter-attacks.

defensive.notes: Stresses the importance of not being deceived by feints and maintaining a high guard against unexpected head kicks.

key_points: Detailed breakdown of right and left head kick techniques, focusing on the necessary body mechanics for effectiveness.
Introduction of the question mark kick as a strategic tool for high line attacks, leveraging the element of surprise.
The significance of kick setup and execution in preventing counterattacks, emphasizing the need for proper angle and shoulder clearance.
Strategies for incorporating high line kicks into fight combinations, enhancing the versatility and unpredictability of a fighter's arsenal.
